item.title: Aetherway: What's Next?
item.description:
Hello, wonderful carbon-based organisms!

Here’s the roadmap for the Aetherway Project moving forward:

  • Rooftop – 600 words — [2025-04-16]
  • Hacker – 500 words — [2025-05-14]
  • Beach Episode – 4,500 words — [2025-06-18]
  • Apartment Dimension I – 800 words — [2025-07-16]
  • Birth Ritual – 1,500+ words (still a work in progress!) — [2025-08-20]

Story Summaries:

Rooftop features an intimate conversation between two friends, Fire and Water. It’s a reflective and intimate story about growing up, facing uncertainties, and finding meaning in fleeting moments.

In Hacker, Lady Entanglement’s personality really shines through—it’s a fun little interaction with Fire, and I think you’re going to love her! The story plays with the idea that the universe itself may be a system open to modification, blending metaphysical speculation with hacker culture and a sense of whimsical mystery.

Beach Episode is the longest story so far! Fire and Water are joined by two new characters, Day and Night, as they embark on an adventure chasing a UFO. This one has a little bit of everything, and it’s set to be the most emotional chapter yet. It explores themes of transformation, pain, and connection, where Fire learns that true bonds require both vulnerability and resilience, as he struggles to accept the inevitable loss that comes with meaningful relationships.

These three stories are all part of Part 2 and are essential for understanding what’s going on. I saved them for last because they’re my favorites! They’ll also more or less conclude the “setup” for the rest of the story. No turning back now—I have to commit to these ideas!

Apartment Dimension I is also part of Part 2, but it could just as easily stand alone as a separate story! It features Fire, Lady Thread, Lady Entanglement, and Millennium Whoop living together in a NYC apartment. This one is by far the funniest story yet!

Finally, we return to Part 1 with Birth Ritual. This story is packed with worldbuilding and offers deep insight into the culture of the Hive People. It follows the Queen giving birth, as seen from Fire’s perspective.

Update Schedule Change:

Earlier, I mentioned updating weekly, but as the chapters grow longer, more complex, and more layered, I’m not sure I can maintain that pace. I don’t want to overpromise and underdeliver, so for now, I’ll be releasing new stories monthly instead. I’d love to post and write more consistently, and this schedule could change if my Ko-fi subscriber count magically goes up. But as it stands, I need to focus on projects that actually bring in income.

Monetization & Sustainability:

New stories will be exclusive to Ko-fi subscribers for two weeks before becoming free on the Aetherway website. This gives subscribers an incentive to support the project while ensuring that the stories remain accessible to everyone. The good news is that the first tier (Whoop whoop!) is now only $1, and posts will also be available for a month to anyone who makes a one-time donation!

I’m really excited to share these stories with you, and I hope you enjoy the journey as much as I do! Your support—whether through Ko-fi, comments, or simply following along—means the world to me. Every bit of encouragement fuels the Aetherway Project and keeps it going!

Which chapter are you most excited to read? I’d love to hear your thoughts!

That’s it for today—have an amazing existence! ✨

item.title: Share your art struggles. I'll start.
item.description:
I pour my struggles into my characters, but unless I spell it out, no one seems to notice. Maybe I need to approach this differently. So I’ll try again.

I’ve been doing commissions for years now—it’s how I make a living. But lately, even picking up a pencil feels impossible. Drawing used to be what I loved most. Now I write stories just to avoid it.

I’m grateful to those who have supported me, truly. I don’t expect anyone to fix this, but I just need to say it: I feel drained. Completely. I don’t think I can deliver my best anymore.

Time keeps slipping away faster than I can process. I keep chasing a way out, but I always end up back where I started.

If you’ve ever felt this way—stuck in a loop, drained by what once gave you joy— Did you find a way out? And if you did… how? Have you faced something else that left you feeling stuck or overwhelmed?

The Aetherway is my journey of healing. It’s about rediscovering the joy that art once brought me. I want to share this journey with you all, and I hope it resonates with those of you who have been through your own struggles. If you believe in my work and want to support my journey, you can find me on Ko-fi.

Your support helps me keep creating and sharing what matters most. Thank you for being here.

Have an amazing existence.

item.title: Is This The End?
item.description:
The Aetherway started as a way to promote my work, but it became something much deeper. I knew that cool designs alone wouldn’t be enough—I needed something that truly resonated with people. So, I poured my soul into this project, and it’s been a rewarding experience. In the process, I’ve discovered myself as a writer, and bringing these stories to life has been both fulfilling and healing. After years of relying solely on commissions, this has given me a creative space that feels like my own.

That said, rewarding doesn’t always mean successful. Getting people to actually support the project has been an uphill battle. I constantly remind people that they can help in multiple ways, yet the results are minimal. It can feel cold and lonely at times—even expecting a comment feels like asking too much. Which is ironic, considering The Aetherway is all about connection.

I realize nobody asked for this, but then again—who asks for anything in This Dimension? Sometimes, you don’t know you want something until you see it. People complain about the current uncreative landscape, but how can new projects thrive when they’re met with indifference? Right now, The Aetherway is just a sprout. But if we nurture it, it can grow into something huge—something we can look back on and say, “Hey, we build this.”

So, I’ve been thinking—maybe I should start paywalling new stories on my Ko-fi, at least temporarily. Maybe I should’ve done this from the start, but I hesitated, weighing the trade-offs of reaching fewer people. Not that I expect comments to magically increase, but at least it would ensure some tangible support. That’s the reality of self-promotion nowadays—sometimes, you have to put a price on what you create, even when you wish you didn’t have to.

What do you think? Should I keep full access to new stories free, knowing they might not continue, or is a small paywall the right move to help The Aetherway grow?

item.title: A New Chapter Unfolds
item.description:
Now that everything is set up and running, I realize that—simple as it looks—this website took far more effort than I initially anticipated.

From now on, I’ll be updating The Epic of the Hive People with new stories on a weekly basis. Over the next few weeks, I’ll be wrapping up the first set of stories. This “setup” is really just to give you an idea of what the hell is going on.

Oh! I may or may not also be working on the next collection of illustrations—but commissions have been keeping me busy, so be sure to support my work in other ways! ♥️

The Aetherway is my gift to humanity—show some love!

Have an amazing existence!

item.title: Post 2
item.description:
hello

E-mail

Believe or not, e-mail can still be used communication; it isn’t just something you need to confirm your account when registering for other services.

  • aetherway@disroot.org

XMPP

I’ve wanted to use XMPP ever since I first learned about it a few years ago—a still-active relic from the 2000s, before social media and smartphones took over. Back then, this was how we communicated online: a small pop-up window on your computer displaying your contacts and their status—online, offline, busy, or away. That whole concept feels somewhat obsolete now, given our constant presence on the web. But I don’t think signaling our availability is pointless. Sometimes, we just want to chat.

Unfortunately, I couldn’t find anyone to chat with in a world that seems to have moved on, but the whole concept of NeoCities has given me hope.

item.title: Subscribe to RSS!
item.description:
The push to revive the ‘old web’—with platforms like NeoCities—brings back the late ’90s and early 2000s aesthetic. But pairing it with RSS feels anachronistic, as they come from different eras. A niche pre-Twitter technology, RSS never saw mainstream adoption.

Still, RSS offers a way to follow sites like social media—without algorithms. In an internet dominated by curated feeds and walled gardens, it remains a direct, decentralized alternative.
